title: Allerdale Ramble Walking Route

images.title: Shaun Ferguson / Allerdale Ramble
images.caption: Allerdale Ramble heading down through High How Woods heading towards Grange

images.title: Bob Jenkins / Millbeck from the Allerdale Ramble Footpath
images.caption: Millbeck from the Allerdale Ramble Footpath. Here the path runs down off Carl Side and drops steeply down Doups into Millbeck.

images.title: Michael Graham / Under Barkbeth Hill
images.caption: Under Barkbeth Hill above High Side

images.title: Philip Halling / Ascending The Edge to Ullock Pike
images.caption: Ascending The Edge to Ullock Pike. The Allerdale Ramble follows this well defined path up to Ullock Pike which can be seen in the middle distance.

images.title: Steve cross / Old mine
images.caption: Old mine. An ancient technique known as a 'Stope' and is literally a slot cut into the hillside to follow the ore vein. It is immediately below the road where the 'Allerdale Ramble' path drops down from 'Catbells' onto the roadway.

description: Explore the stunning scenery of the Lake District on this wonderful trail. The trail begins at Seathwaite at the foot of the stunning Great Gable mountain. The route then heads through Borrowdale to Keswick, climbing Castle Crag and passing Catbells on the way. You then pass the stunning Derwent Water and Bassenthwaite Lake on your way to Cockermouth . The trail then heads to the coast at Maryport where the final stretch takes you along the lovely Cumbrian Coastline to Silloth . The Maryport to Allonby Walk along the Cumbria Coastal Way can also be linked with in this area.
